summary: This is an email exchange between two individuals regarding a FOIA request related to Jeffrey Epstein. The sender is checking whether a one-page attorney visit room inventory log, which contains inmate names but not Tartaglione, can be released with privacy redactions. The recipient confirms no issues if Tartaglione's name is not on it.

persons.name: Swergold, Jason
persons.role: US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) employee
persons.context: Recipient of an email regarding a FOIA check on Epstein documents; confirms no issues if a specific name is not on the document.

persons.name: Tartaglione
persons.role: Individual of interest in FOIA context
persons.context: Mentioned as a name that is not on the attorney visit room inventory log being considered for release under FOIA.

persons.name: Epstein, Jeffrey
persons.context: The FOIA request being discussed is related to him.

persons.name: Noel
persons.context: Referenced as the team that now believes the attorney visit room inventory log can be released with privacy redactions.

connections.description: Swergold is involved in correspondence regarding a FOIA request related to Epstein.

events.title: FOIA Check-in on Epstein Document
events.description: Email exchange regarding the potential release of a one-page attorney visit room inventory log under a FOIA request related to Jeffrey Epstein.

keyFacts: An attorney visit room inventory log with inmate names was previously withheld under FOIA exemption 7(A) but is now considered releasable with privacy redactions.
The document does not contain the name Tartaglione, which alleviates concerns about its release.
The correspondence indicates ongoing FOIA processing related to Jeffrey Epstein's case as of January 2021.
